intro: Dicella amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian daisy, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling a daisy. Dicella amazonica thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found near streams or in dense undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
